item.title: Terrace Farming robot
item.description:
About the Competition

This Competition was held during the 8th Inter IIT Tech Meet. During this meet, different tech competitions are conducted between IITs. One of them was the "DIC's Terrace Farming Challenge for Hilly areas". The task was to design an autonomous robot that can climb steps of 40cm and perform basic farming tasks like Cutting, Plucking, etc.



Problem Statement

Our Solution

item.title: Flipkart Robotcs Challenge
item.description:
About Flipkart Grid 2.0 - Robotcs Challenge

During the pandemic period, Flipkart conducted an interesting competition for robotics enthusiasts under Flipkart Grid 2.0. There were three problem statements :

  • Intelligent Picking
  • Autonomous Indoor Drone
  • Autonomous Stair Climbing Robot.
We chose the Autonomous Indoor Drone Challenge in which we had to propose the solution of drone which will be able to carry 2kgs of load and able to navigate through a series of windows randomly placed in a room

Our Solution

I designed the cad model consisting of depth camera (for navigation and localization), computation unit (Rpi4) and bucket (to carry payload). The design was based on the contrains due to size of window through which it has to pass.
Here are some images of the design:

After design was ready, our next step was to perform stability and structural analysis on frame of quadcopter in order to ensure that it will sustain in given conditions. At the same time team has to make a simulation of quad performing the tasks given problem statement.
I performed stress analysis and modal analysis on the frame using ANSYS simulation software using FEA model


Watch simulation video

Current Status of project

We cracked the simulation Challenge and now we are in national finale!!! only 3 teams got selected for finale. Our next target is to develope actual prototype

item.title: Team Aerov
item.description:
About Team Aerov

Team Aerov is a part of UMIC ( Umesh Mashruwal Innovation Cell ), IIT Bombay. This team focuses on Aerial robots related competition in worldwide. It has already participated in IARC Mission 7 and Barcelona Smart Drone challenge. Currently, it is focusing on IARC Mission 9. The detailed problem statement for IARC Mission 9 can be found here. Current major tasks are to travel 3 miles of distance and perform the task of replacing the communication module using the robotic arm on the drone

My contribution : Mechatronics Subsystem

My Current work is to design robotic arm with gripper for performing the tasks given in IARC Mission 9. I have made models for it and now working on optimizing its weight
